node.text:
From a very early age, African-American civil rights icon and #UnitedNations leader, Ralph Bunche understood the pain and peril of racism.

Yet Bunche turned those experiences into a catalyst for change on the international stage, pursuing a legendary career as one of the most senior diplomatic officials of his time. 

From walking side-by-side with Dr. Martin Luther King Jr., to working for peace as a UN mediator in Palestine, watch and learn more about the Nobel Prize Laureate. 

#FightRacism

node.title: Hero for Justice on the World's Stage

node.text:
"Because of climate change we are seeing even more intense storms, rising sea levels and many deaths. But we don’t have to accept this – we can act - and we must act as a matter of justice."

Environmentalist Sunita Narain explains why it's important that all of us #ActNow to achieve the goals of the #ParisAgreement. 

"Every country, rich or poor, is exposed to extreme weather. We need to build better and more resilient infrastructure – from electricity grids to roads, bridges and buildings. All these approaches are set out in the Paris Climate Agreement – adopted by nearly 200 countries. We can do it – we must do it – and we must act quickly."

From recycling to using less energy and water to opting for public transport, each and every one of us can take little steps in our everyday lives that can have a big impact. Tell us in the comments what you are doing to protect our planet.

#ClimateAction #GlobalGoals

node.text:
"We don’t have to choose between using energy and protecting the planet."

@unep Young Champion of the Earth Nzambi Matee explains the role sustainable energy plays in building a better future for all. 
 
"Imagine a world where every job is based on clean, renewable energy – and where wind and solar are even more abundant. And where energy is affordable and reliable – and available to everyone. This might sound like a fantasy – but it’s achievable and we know how to get there."

The #ParisAgreement on the climate emergency is our roadmap for moving to a low-carbon economy and achieving a sustainable future. Since this international #ClimateAction treaty opened for signature 5 years ago, almost 200 countries have signed on to tackle the climate crisis together to limit global warming to protect people and planet.

 #GlobalGoals #ActNow

node.text:
Cities are major contributors to the climate crisis, but also an important hub for #ClimateAction.

@UNEP Young Champion of the Earth Nzambi Matee explains what a green future for cities could look like & how the #ParisAgreement can help us get there.

node.text: Meet @unep Young Champion of the Earth Nzambi Matee. She's a Kenyan engineer taking #ClimateAction and helping to #BeatPlasticPollution by recycling plastic waste into building materials.

node.text:
"My warmest wishes to everyone celebrating #EidAlFitr," #UnitedNations Secretary-General @antonioguterres said on Wednesday.

"I was delighted to mark the end of Ramadan with Asia El-Sayeed Ali, a Yemeni health worker helping malnourished children and mothers in a @worldfoodprogramme-supported nutrition clinic.

Asia personifies core values of Ramadan: compassion and empathy. Her resilience in the face of the devastating conflict in Yemen, as well as her life-saving work in support of people in desperate need have moved me greatly.

As #Ramadan comes to an end, let us continue drawing inspiration from its many lessons of solidarity that are celebrated during this Holy Month."

Regram: @antonioguterres

node.text:
Regram: @antonioguterres

Young people are the most affected by the climate decisions taken today. Their ideas, voices and actions are crucial to deliver meaningful and ambitious #ClimateAction for all.

@pcopaloma and @mahery_loha are two inspiring climate activists who exemplify the leadership and commitment of young people worldwide to address the most challenging problems we face today.

I'm grateful for our discussion and their insights on how to achieve the meaningful participation of youth, women and indigenous peoples as we tackle the climate crisis.

#ActNow #GlobalGoals

node.text:
@unep Goodwill Ambassador @aidanrgallagher describes how the #ParisAgreement can help us create a world free from the threats of the climate crisis. 

"This is personal for me," he explains. "I don’t want to choke on the air I breathe, or see wildfires burning out of control. So let’s keep working together. And you too can protect what is left and repair what has been damaged."

On Thursday's #EarthDay, @antonioguterres will be joining the U.S. Leaders’ Summit on Climate to reiterate his call for urgent #ClimateAction. 

"The Paris Agreement is our pact with our children, grandchildren & the whole human family," said the Secretary-General. 

"The climate crisis is the race of our lifetimes. We must go much further, and much faster."

#GenerationRestoration #ForNature

node.text: On Monday's International Day of Human Space Flight, @europeanspaceagency astronaut @thom_astro became the newest @fao Goodwill Ambassador. He will use his voice and unique perspective from space to advocate for #ClimateAction and to help reduce hunger.

node.title: French astronaut Thomas Pesquet becomes newest @fao Goodwill Ambassador

node.text:
All children have the right to a happy and healthy childhood, free from discrimination and full of love and acceptance. And acceptance begins at home. Every child should grow up in safe, loving and nurturing environment.

No child should suffer because of who they are. All children deserve protection and equal rights. Let's see kids the way they see themselves.

On Wednesday's International Transgender Day of Visibility, join @unaidsglobal in calling for the rights of transgender children to be protected.

#TransDayOfVisibility #SeeMeAsIAm

node.text:
Six years since the start of the conflict, millions of Yemenis are in need of humanitarian assistance. Over four million are displaced within the country. 

Our colleagues from UNHCR, the #UnitedNations Refugees Agency, are in #Yemen providing aid, but they cannot do it alone. 

Please click the link in the @refugees' bio to help. 

#YemenCantWait

node.text:
Maya (@ghazalmia) fled Damascus, #Syria at age 16 and overcame numerous barriers to become the world’s first female Syrian refugee pilot. 

Check out her inspiring story!

#WithRefugees

node.title: Meet Maya Ghazal, the newest @refugees Goodwill Ambassador

node.accessibility_caption: Photo by United Nations on September 19, 2021. May be an image of 4 people, people standing and text that says 'I PROMISE TO... CE4E SPEAK UP FOR GENDER EQUALITY'.

node.text:
Secretary-General @antonioguterres has joined the Keeping the Promise movement! 

"Every one of us has the power to take action and help deliver on the #GlobalGoals - the world's to-do list to ensure a safer, healthier and a more sustainable future for everyone.

I promise to speak up for gender equality because realizing the equal rights and empowerment of women and girls remains the unfinished human rights struggle of this century.

Only though gender equality can we benefit from the intelligence, experience and insights of all of humanity. As a proud feminist, I have made gender equality a top priority and gender parity a reality in top #UnitedNations jobs. I urge all leaders to do the same."

Go to link in our bio to join the Secretary-General, @bts.bighitofficial, world leaders, influencers and people around the world by making a promise to keep! Tell us in the comments which one YOU choose. 

Regram @antonioguterres

node.accessibility_caption: Photo shared by United Nations on September 18, 2021 tagging @swissmissionnyc. May be an image of skyscraper.

node.text:
This stunning, ecofriendly fresco showing two children working to build the world of tomorrow has been painted on the lawn of #UnitedNations Headquarters in #NYC by graffiti artist @saype_artiste and gifted to the UN by #Switzerland.

Ahead of #UNGA high-level week, the artwork is a beautiful reminder of the need to work together for a better future. 

"I hope leaders will take inspiration from Saype’s art to consider how we can look beyond our immediate surroundings, while respecting nature and our planet," said UN Secretary-General @antonioguterres. "Children and young people are showing the way. We must listen to them and be guided by their priorities."

📷: Saype / Valentin Flauraud

#GlobalGoals

node.text:
Thanks to @bts.bighitofficial for supporting the #GlobalGoals with the promise to help #FightRacism. 

On Monday, they will visit #UnitedNations Headquarters in #NYC, where they will join Secretary-General @antonioguterres and world leaders with a special performance at our SDG Moment event to inspire action for a better world for everyone. 

Use the link in our bio to join BTS in pledging your support for creating a more inclusive, sustainable future!

Share YOUR promise in the comments below!

node.accessibility_caption: Photo by United Nations on September 18, 2021. May be a cartoon of bicycle and text.

node.text:
On average, women are paid 16% less than men.

For women of colour, immigrant women & women with children, the difference is even greater.

The right to receive equal remuneration for work of equal value is essential to achieving gender equality and a fairer, more inclusive world. 

"Let’s resolve to dismantle the discrimination and harmful gender stereotypes that contribute to the gender pay gap," said #UnitedNations Secretary-General @antonioguterres  on Saturday's #EqualPayDay.

Today & every day, join @unwomen in demanding equal pay for all!

#GlobalGoals

node.accessibility_caption: Photo by United Nations on September 17, 2021. May be an image of 1 person, standing, outdoors and temple.

node.text:
Regram @antonioguterres 

Ringing the Peace Bell located at #UnitedNations Headquarters in #NYC is a longstanding #PeaceDay tradition based on the founding purpose of our Organization: preventing war and promoting peace.

At a time when humanity is in crisis - amid the #COVID19 pandemic, conflicts, growing inequalities and a climate emergency - it is also a call to lay down the guns, renew our trust in one another and commit to building a better world.

We must make peace with nature — and with one another.
We must lift each other up, instead of knocking each other down.
We must always choose peace.

Peace is possible.
Peace is necessary.
Peace is the only pathway to a sustainable future.
For all people in all countries.

📷: UN Photo / Cia Pak

#GlobalGoals #ClimateAction #StandUp4HumanRights

node.text:
Watch history unfold during the 76th session of #UNGA next week. 

Follow the action, as world leaders seek solutions to some of the most serious threats facing humanity, from #COVID19 to the climate emergency and from humanitarian crisis to poverty, hunger and more.

node.accessibility_caption: Photo by United Nations on September 17, 2021. May be a black-and-white image of skyscraper.

node.text:
#FBF to 1969 when this black and white photo was taken of #UnitedNations Headquarters. Pictured are the 39-story UN Secretariat building (right), the General Assembly building (centre), and the Library (foreground). 

While UNHQ is located in #NYC, the Organization has a presence around the world and works for everyone, everywhere. 

Next week, the leaders of 193 countries will come together for the 76th session of the #UNGA, where they will work together on some of the biggest challenges facing humanity.

📷: UN Photo

#FlashbackFriday

node.accessibility_caption: Photo by United Nations on September 16, 2021.

node.text:
Sneak peek behind the scenes: #UnitedNations staff members work around the clock to put finishing touches on the iconic General Assembly Hall at UN Headquarters in #NYC, ahead of the General Debate -- the busiest week on the diplomatic calendar. 

The GA Hall is the largest room at UNHQ and the meeting place of all 193 member countries. 

Next week, world leaders will come together for the 76th session of #UNGA to find common ground and seek solutions for some of the world's greatest challenges.

📷: United Nations

#GlobalGoals

SPEAK OUT HELP END VIOLE AGAINST WOMEN GIRLS PROMISE TO... CHIEVE NET ZERO ;ARBON EMISSIONS 2050 WE PROMISE TO ADD YOUR PHOTO! IISE SPEAK FOR GENDER EQI Σ |PROMISE TO... SUPPORT ANI INCLUSIVE SUSTAINABLE RECOVERY ACHIEVE NET ZERO CARBON EMISSIONS BY 2050 TPROMOL TO... ROMISE TO... REDUCE MY FOOD WASTE ONLY WHAT NEED REDUCE, REPAIR, REUSE, REPURPOSE, RECYCLE SOLIDARITY KINDNESS TO PEOPLEIN NEED'.

node.text:
People around the world are pledging their support for delivering on the promise of the #GlobalGoals. 

From reducing food waste to speaking up for gender equality and showing solidarity and kindness to people in need, each of us can take small daily actions in our everyday lives to make a big difference.

Ahead of next week's #UNGA, head to the link in our bio to learn how you can share your photo and inspire others to help create a better future for all!

node.accessibility_caption: Photo by United Nations on September 16, 2021. May be an image of text that says 'This is a CRISIS unicef for every child'.

node.text:
The #COVID19 pandemic has taken away so much from so many. For nearly 77 million children, it has taken away their classrooms for the past 18 months.⁣
⁣
@unicef has closed down their social media channels for 18 hours to send one message to the world: #ReopenSchools as soon as possible.⁣
⁣
They'll be back tomorrow. When will children be back in school?

Regram: @unicef

node.accessibility_caption: Photo by United Nations in United Nations. May be an image of 7 people and indoor.

node.text:
#TBT to September 2018, when @bts.bighitofficial took part in #UNGA to engage with and empower young people.

On Monday, they will visit us again at #UnitedNations Headquarters in #NYC to show support for the #GlobalGoals and help inspire ambitious action to create a better future for all. 

See link in bio to join them and help inspire action to create a better world for everyone. 

📷: UN Photo / Mark Garten

#ThrowbackThursday
